instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.3V3_S4: What is 3V3_S4? This is an abbreviation of PP3V3_S4, a 3.3v power rail when the machine is in an S4 state. .
definitions.S4_PWR_EN: What is S4_PWR_EN? S4_PWR_EN turns on the S4 power rails. Signals ending in _EN enable whatever came before _EN in the signal name when the voltage of the signal is high. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: computer does not detect keyboard and trackpad, I already tried another trackpad and ipd cable, problem persists.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Same problem before and after enter to macOS?
Can you acces boot menu?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: it's always the same problem before and after, I can't access the boot menu, enter the user directly and the cursor doesn't move there, and neither does the keyboard

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Check J4800 voltage; pins 1, 10, 14, 19.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
3.4v  pin1
1.9v. pin10
5.1v pin 14
3.41v pin 19v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Change <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
change <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR> pin 10 2.4v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>=3.3v <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>=2.4v, change <CHIP>U8000</CHIP> because it is physically damaged, problem persists

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: What is <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> voltage with trackpad disconnected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I measured those values with the trackpad disconnected, only with the board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
<CHIP>U8000</CHIP> gets <SIGNAL>S4_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>?
If yes, check diode mode to ground at <RESISTOR>R8000</RESISTOR> pads.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>S4_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>=3.3v
diode mode to ground at <RESISTOR>R8000</RESISTOR>=0.39

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Change again <CHIP>U8000</CHIP>.
Be sure to get good solders...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Ok, change again <CHIP>U8000</CHIP> and then <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL>=2.5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>=3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Bypass <CHIP>U8000</CHIP> and check if <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> also drops.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: disculpe cuando se refiere a bypass <CHIP>U8000</CHIP>, se refiere que quite <CHIP>U8000</CHIP> y que haga una union con un cable <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> a <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
No hace falta quitar el chip.
Si notas algo raro, entonces si mejor quitarlo.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: bypass <CHIP>U8000</CHIP>, then <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>=3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
So you have now correct <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> too.
What is the actual symptom?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL>=3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: The board boots, check something more?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: if it turns on and the trackpad works, can I leave it with bypass? strange why does this happen, yes I changed <CHIP>U8000</CHIP> 2 times?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: This implies <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> presence in off state, with charger connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: So what do I do about it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Check the current consumption in off state, with charger connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: cuando se refiere off state, es el computador apagado conectado a la bateria?, y para medir el consumo de corriente lo hago conectando la fuente de poder al equipo y mirando valor display de la fuente?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Apagado, con cargador, pero sin bateria.
Asi descartas la corriente de carga bateria.
Interesa saber solo el consumo de la placa.

Alimenta con la fuente de laboratorio, claro.
Compara el consumo con un equipo perfectamente funcional.
